Here is the output, wrapped in tags as requested:

Responding to Customer Inquiries and Claim Investigations

1. Carefully review the customer inquiry or claim investigation details to fully understand the situation and context before contacting the customer. Gather any relevant information you will need to discuss. 2. Contact the customer in a timely manner, using their preferred method of communication if known (phone, email, etc.). If calling, aim to reach them at a convenient time. 3. Greet the customer in a friendly, professional manner. Identify yourself and the company. Confirm you are speaking with the right person before disclosing any account details. 4. Clearly explain the reason for your call, whether it is to respond to their initial inquiry or to notify them of claim investigation results and any adjustments. 5. Listen attentively to the customer's comments or concerns. Show empathy and understanding. Apologize sincerely if the company made an error or if the situation has inconvenienced them. 6. Provide clear explanations and specific information relevant to their inquiry or claim. Avoid insurance jargon; use plain language they can easily understand. 7. If explaining a claims decision or account adjustment, walk through the details so they understand how and why that conclusion was reached. Offer to send follow-up documentation. 8. Allow the customer opportunities to ask questions. Provide thorough answers or offer to investigate further if needed. Maintain a patient, professional demeanor at all times. 9. Summarize any key points from the conversation. Explain any next steps, whether it's information they need to provide or further actions your company will take. 10. Thank the customer for their time. Provide your contact information in case they have additional questions or concerns. End on a positive, helpful note.
